data.author: Socrates
data.en: It is not living that matters, but living rightly.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Let him that would move the world first move himself.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Beauty is the bait which with delight allures man to enlarge his kind.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: A system of morality which is based on relative emotional values is a mere illusion, a thoroughly vulgar conception which has nothing sound in it and nothing true.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: I am the wisest man alive, for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: The end of life is to be like God, and the soul following God will be like Him.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: I know nothing except the fact of my ignorance.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Where there is reverence there is fear, but there is not reverence everywhere that there is fear, because fear presumably has a wider extension than reverence.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: I only wish that ordinary people had an unlimited capacity for doing harm; then they might have an unlimited power for doing good.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: As to marriage or celibacy, let a man take which course he will, he will be sure to repent.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Wisdom begins in wonder.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: The unexamined life is not worth living.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: If a man is proud of his wealth, he should not be praised until it is known how he employs it.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Worthless people live only to eat and drink; people of worth eat and drink only to live.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Once made equal to man, woman becomes his superior.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Ordinary people seem not to realize that those who really apply themselves in the right way to philosophy are directly and of their own accord preparing themselves for dying and death.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: If all misfortunes were laid in one common heap whence everyone must take an equal portion, most people would be contented to take their own and depart.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: The poets are only the interpreters of the gods.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings, so that you shall gain easily what others have labored hard for.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Be as you wish to seem.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: To know, is to know that you know nothing. That is the meaning of true knowledge.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: All men's souls are immortal, but the souls of the righteous are immortal and divine.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: He is a man of courage who does not run away, but remains at his post and fights against the enemy.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: An honest man is always a child.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: By all means, marry. If you get a good wife, you'll become happy; if you get a bad one, you'll become a philosopher.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: I was really too honest a man to be a politician and live.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: One who is injured ought not to return the injury, for on no account can it be right to do an injustice; and it is not right to return an injury, or to do evil to any man, however much we have suffered from him.

data.author: Socrates
data.en: The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
